summary_variants.short_answer: Neil Armstrong was an American astronaut and aeronautical engineer who became the first human to walk on the Moon during Apollo 11 in 1969.
summary_variants.kid_friendly: Neil Armstrong flew to the Moon, climbed down a ladder, and took the first human steps on its surface in 1969.
summary_variants.standard: Neil Armstrong (1930–2012) was an American test pilot, aeronautical engineer, and NASA astronaut who commanded the Apollo 11 mission and performed the first crewed lunar landing. Before joining NASA’s astronaut corps, he flew combat missions in Korea and test piloted advanced aircraft for NACA.
summary_variants.expert_notes: Cover his Gemini 8 docking, the LM descent manual landing, post-NASA academic career, and work on investigation boards.

roles_offices: Professor of Aerospace Engineering, University of Cincinnati
notable_actions: Executed first crewed lunar landing and EVA
Served on the Rogers Commission after the Challenger accident
education: University of Southern California (MS Aerospace Engineering)
